title: Coca-Cola Posts Higher Quarterly Sales as Demand Holds Up
sub_head: Beverage giant maintains full-year view despite strong sales amid rising input costs for sugar, aluminum
body:
Coca-Cola Co. logged higher sales for the latest quarter as demand held up amid price increases, which helped the beverage giant offset surging input costs.
Despite the stronger-than-expected results, Coke stuck to its full-year earnings guidance, which includes expectations that commodity-cost increases will be a mid-single-digit percentage headwind to the cost of goods sold.
